intro: Ceraia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy ceraia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Ceraia strigosa is often found in moist, shady environments such as forests and along stream banks.
